tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE identity_management (
    user_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    user_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    user_email VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    user_role ENUM('Admin', 'User') NOT NULL,
    is_verified BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE
);

CREATE TABLE IdentityVerification (
    user_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    full_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    id_number VARCHAR(20) UNIQUE,
    photo BLOB,
    verification_status BOOLEAN
);

CREATE TABLE AccessControls (
    access_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INT,
    access_level INT,
    access_time TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES IdentityVerification(user_id)
);

CREATE TABLE IdentityVerification (
    user_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    full_name VARCHAR(255),
    email VARCHAR(255) UNIQUE,
    phone_number VARCHAR(20),
    verification_status BOOLEAN
);
CREATE TABLE User ( user_id INT PRIMARY KEY, username VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, email VARCHAR(100) UNIQUE, password VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL, created_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL );
CREATE TABLE Role ( role_id INT PRIMARY KEY, role_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, description TEXT, created_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL );
CREATE TABLE UserRoleMapping ( user_id INT, role_id INT, PRIMARY KEY (user_id, role_id), FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES User(user_id), FOREIGN KEY (role_id) REFERENCES Role(role_id) );

CREATE TABLE AccessControl ( access_id INT PRIMARY KEY, resource_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL, user_id INT, role_id INT, permission VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL, created_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL, FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES User(user_id), FOREIGN KEY (role_id) REFERENCES Role(role_id) );

CREATE TABLE user_identities (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    username VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    email VARCHAR(100) UNIQUE,
    password VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    created_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL
)

CREATE TABLE access_controls (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INT NOT NULL,
    resource_id INT NOT NULL,
    access_level ENUM('READ','WRITE','ADMIN') NOT NULL,
    created_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL
)

CREATE TABLE user_roles (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    role_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    description TEXT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL
)

CREATE TABLE role_permissions (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    role_id INT NOT NULL,
    permission VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    resource_id INT NOT NULL
)

CREATE TABLE user_sessions (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INT NOT NULL,
    session_token VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    expiration_time TIMESTAMP NOT NULL
)
